page.title: 12Farm survey the results
page.content: The numbers of livestock held {ANIMAL | FARM} | A B C D E F CATTLE | 130 125 100 140 0 3 SHEEP | 190 386 200 50 530 0 PIGS | 2 254 0 10 1 0 FOWLS | 0 24 0 0 3 52 OTHERS | 0 1 0 0 3 10 TOTAL | 322 790 300 200 537 65 Farms A,B and D also had several acres of cereal mainly wheat and barley for feeding their own stock. Four of the six said that the biggest change had been{intensification}either in the number of animals raised per acre or the frequency and volume of silage taken. The livestock is sold at local markets eg.Launceston,Holsworthy,Liskeard.Farm D sold its milk to the Milk Marketing Board.Farm B sold its pigs to Cornish Quality Bacon.
